Header: 13 STF officers and policeman acquitted over quintuple murder
Content: Thirteen Special Task Force officers accused of shooting and killing of five persons in 2006, have been acquitted from the charges against them.The acquittal order was delivered by the Trincomalee High Court. The defence attorney said the suspects were acquitted as adequate evidence was not submitted against them.He mentioned that a previous court proceeding had also acquitted them from the charges. Twelve STF officers and one policeman were charged for allegedly shooting and killing five persons including two university students while injuring two others at the Gandhi Roundabout in Trincomalee in 2006
